article.simpara: Use the dfx config command to view or configure settings in the configuration file for a current project. Note that you can only run this command from within the project directory structure. For example, if your project name is hello_world, your current working directory must be the hello_world top-level project directory or one of its subdirectories.

entry.simpara: Specifies the format of the configuration file output. By default, the file is displayed using JSON format. The valid values are json and text.

section.title: Arguments
section.simpara: You can specify the following arguments for the dfx config command.

entry.simpara: Specifies the name of the configuration option that you want to set or read. You must specify the configuration file option using its period-delineated path to set or read the specific option you want to change or view. If you don’t specify the path to a specific configuration option, the command displays the full configuration file.
Specifies the new value for the option you are changing. If you donâ€™t specify a value, the command returns the current value for the option from the configuration file.
